document.docAuthor: Yoshizawa, Satoshi, Tachi, Takuji, Praxaysonbath, Bounthob & Suzuki, Dai
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of the genus Pygophora Schiner from Laos (Diptera: Muscidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of the genus Pygophora Schiner from Laos (Diptera: Muscidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Pygophora immaculipennis
Frey, 1917
: 15
. Lectotype male ( UZMH , not examined), by designation of
Crosskey ( 1962 : 434 )
. Type locality: Anuradhapura, Sri Lanka .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Redescription. Male
. Head (
Fig. 1
). Fronto-orbital plate, face and parafacial yellowish white; gena and occiput gray; frontal vitta cream yellow to orange; antenna with scape, pedicel, first flagellomere, first and second aristomeres cream yellow; third aristomere brown; palpus and labellum whitish yellow; prementum dark or reddish brown. Two frontal setae; 2 reclinate orbital setae; first flagellomere 2.8 –3.0 times as long as pedicel; third aristomere plumose only on basal half.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–4. Male head and abdomen in lateral view. 1 . Male head of
Pygophora immaculipennis Frey.
2 . Male head of
P. laoensis
sp. nov. 3
. Male abdomen of
P. immaculipennis Frey
(setae omitted). 4 . Male abdomen of
P. laoensis
sp. nov.
(setae omitted). (Scale bars = 0.2 mm). (Abbreviations: comp eye: compound eye; dk: dorsal keel; ped: pedicel; syn 1+2: syntergite 1+2; T3: tergite 3; T4: tergite 4; T5: tergite 5; thr ari: third aristomere).

FIGURES 5–9. Male sternite 5, male and female terminalia of
Pygophora immaculipennis Frey
: 5 . Epandrium, surstylus and cerci in lateral view. 6 . Same in dorsal view (setae omitted on the left side). 7 . Male sternite 5 in ventral view (setae omitted on the left side). 8 . Hypandrium, pregonite, postgonite and phallus in lateral view. 9 . Female terminalia in lateral view. (Scale bars = 0.2 mm). (Abbreviations: bcs: bacilliform sclerite; cerc: cerci; epand: epandrium; epi: epiproct; hypand: hypandrium; pgt: postgonite; ph: phallus; prgt: pregonite; S5: sternite 5; S6: sternite 6; sur: surstylus; T7: tergite 7; T8: tergite 8).

subSubSection.paragraph: Thorax. Dorsum and pleura black in ground color with gray pruinosity; anterior and posterior spiracles yellow.

Legs. Fore coxa, trochanters, femora, tibiae, tarsi and pulvilli brownish yellow; mid and hind coxae gray in basal part, brownish yellow apically. Fore tibia with 2 distinctive anterodorsal and 1 posterior setae; mid femur with 2 preapical posterior setae; mid tibia with 1 anterodorsal seta on apical third and 2 posterodorsal setae; hind tibia with 2 anterodorsal, 1 anteroventral, 2 posterodorsal and 1 posteroventral setae.
Body length . 4.6–6.2 mm (males and females, n= 42 ).

Material examined. LAOS ,
4 males
,
10 females
, Mekong river, Vientiane city [
N 17 ° 57 ’ 46 ”
/
E 102 ° 35 ’ 13 ”
],
23–24 . VIII. 2013
;
2 females
, Pakthoay [
N 18 ° 27 ’06”
/
E 103 ° 24 ’ 52 ”
],
29 . VIII. 2013
. JAPAN ,

, Henaji, Motobu town, Kunigami-gun, Okinawa pref. [
N 26 ° 39 ’ 20 ”
/
E 127 ° 53 ’ 39 ”
],
24 . VI. 2013
;
2 males
,

, Kayo, Nago city, Okinawa pref. [

,

;

,

, Genka, Nago city, Okinawa pref. [

,

;

/

/
E 123 ° 46 ’ 42 ”
],
27 . V. 2012
.
Distribution. China , India , Japan (Ryukyus), Laos , Myanmar , Pakistan , Sri Lanka and Taiwan .
Bionomics. This species was collected in a grassland and rice paddy field.

Remarks. This species resembles
Pygophora confusa Stein
and
P. torrida (Wiedemann)
, but is distinguished from them by having a slender hind tibia in the male, and entirely yellow first flagellomere and femora in the female. This is the first record of
P. immaculipennis
from Laos .
